cocus#Workshop: The workshop is a child of an event which is a child of Thing.

cocus#Event: The event Thing is the parent of both the workshop and the conference.

cocus#User: The parent of the user is the author and the corresponding author. The child of the user is the administrator and the parent of the committee.

cocus#Role: The role of the child of Thing is to be the parent of the head role, the admin role, the author role and the reviewer role.

cocus#Help_Request: The help request is the parent of both the feature request and the help request. The help request is also the parent of the event creation activity.

cocus#Person: The child of a Thing is the parent of the user and the administrator. The author is the parent of the corresponding author.

cocus#Symposium: The symposium is the parent event of the conference.

cocus#Abstract: The abstract is a child of paper which is the parent of invited paper.

cocus#Paper: The paper is the parent of both the short paper and the full paper. It is also the parent of the submission paper and the invited paper.

cocus#Administrator: The administrator is the child of the person who is the parent of the user and the parent of the committee.

cocus#Document: The paper is the parent of the abstract, the document is the parent of the email, the group email and the submission.

cocus#Invited_Paper: The invited paper is a child of paper which is the parent of the abstract.

cocus#Admin_Role: The admin role is child of the author role and the parent role.

cocus#Paper_Typologies: The paper apologies is a child of the event setup which is the parent of the review form.

cocus#Event_Setup: The event setup is the parent of the review form and the submission template. It is also the parent of the research topic, the event tracks and the email template.

cocus#Event_URL: The event url is a child of url.

cocus#URL: url is the parent of event url.

cocus#Notification_Email: The notification email is a child of the email and the document is the parent of the submission.

cocus#Email: Email is a child of document, review email, approval email, notification email, rejection email and group email.

cocus#Short_Paper: The short paper is a child of paper and a document. It is also a child of a Thing.

cocus#Author_Role: The author role is child of the Thing.

cocus#Preview: The review form is the parent of the review form setup and is the child of the preview form.

cocus#Review_Form: The review form is a child of the event setup which is the parent of the submission template. It is also the parent of the preview form.

cocus#Review: The document review is the child of the document submission.

cocus#Committe_Role: The role of a committee member is child of the role of a reviewer.

cocus#Group_Email: Group email is a child of email and a document. Thing is also a child of email.

cocus#Submission_Template: The submission template is a child of the event setup which is the parent of the email template.

cocus#Review_Form_Setup: The review form is the child of the review form and the parent of the preview form.

cocus#Misc: Misc is a child of help request which is a child of an activity.

cocus#Author: The author is the child of the user and the parent of the committee. The corresponding author is the author.

cocus#Event_Creation: Event creation is child of activity which is parented by registration.

cocus#Approval_Email: The approval email is a child of email and is a parent of group email.

cocus#Rejection_Email: The rejection email is the child of email and the approval email.

cocus#Submission: The submission is child of the document which is parented by paper and the abstract.

cocus#Template: The template is child of document which is child of Thing.

cocus#Feature_Request: The help request is a child of the help request and is a child of the activity which is the parent of the event creation.

cocus#Committee: The child of a committee is the child of a user.

cocus#Event_Tracks: paper apologies is the parent of event setup which is a child of event tracks.

cocus#Request: The help request is the parent of the feature request and the event approval request.

cocus#Activity: The parent of a request is a request for help, the parent of a request for registration and the parent of an event approval.

cocus#Head_Role: The head role is child of the Thing.

cocus#Detail: The detail is child of Thing.

cocus#Corresponding_Author: The corresponding author is the child of the user and the author is the child of the person.

cocus#Reviewer_Role: The role of the reviewer is child of the author and the parent of the reviewer.

cocus#Event_Approval: Event approval is child of activity which is parent of registration.

cocus#Registration: The registration is a child of the activity which is the parent of the event creation.

cocus#Full_Paper: The full paper is the child of paper and is the parent of the invited paper.

cocus#Research_Topic: The research topic is child of event setup which is the parent of paper apologies.

cocus#Conference: The conference is a child of Thing.

cocus#Assistance: The help request is a child of the help request.

cocus#Email_Template: The email template is a child of the event setup which is the parent of the research topic.
